content.prompt: Which of the following best explains the Mongols’ actions against the caliph as described in the passage?

choices.label: The caliph represented political and economic opposition to Mongol expansion.
The caliph had lost religious authority among Muslims after the Mongol victory.
The caliph had overthrown the nomadic Ottoman Turks.
The caliph had allied with Shi‘a tribes to challenge the Sunni Mongols.

topic.text: 2.2: The Mongol Empire and the Making of the Modern World
